title: Simulation-Based Expert Course for Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A long-term educational program for advanced learners comprising professionals in healthcare, legal, and technical fields. Focuses on strengthening collaborative learning design competencies in a VR simulation environment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply a collaborative learning design framework considering tasks, team formation, time management, and technology integration within a CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) context.
Learners can design activities to solve real-world job problems using collaborative learning flow patterns (CLFP) and scripts in simulation/VR environments.
Learners can continuously improve the efficiency of collaborative learning design through formative assessments and operate feedback systems utilizing technological tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
